intro: Duguetia flagellaris, commonly known as the golden trumpet or yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble trumpets. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Duguetia flagellaris thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in warm climates.
